meta.name: description
meta.content: San Gabriel Unified School District serves grades K-12 and is located in San Gabriel, California.

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High School honored 400 graduates during the school’s commencement ceremony on June 4.

img.alt: Del Mar High graduates pose for a picture

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Del Mar High School students celebrate their successful pursuit of a diploma during the continuation school’s graduation ceremony on June 6.

img.alt: FBLA students holding their awards

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High School’s Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA) program will advance 15 members to the FBLA National Leadership Conference in late June.

img.alt: Roosevelt students playing their instruments

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Roosevelt Elementary’s Mariachi band elective students perform at the fourth annual MIE Unity Fest on April 27.

img.alt: Washington students pose with their artwork

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto

img.div: Washington Elementary students showcase their artwork during ArtFest, a celebration of student talent and creative expression, on April 26.

img.alt: Students write down negative thoughts

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto

img.div: Students write down negative thoughts and shred them in the quad as an exercise about self-esteem relief during Gabrielino High School’s Mental Health Day on April 18.

img.alt: Three GHS students pose for a picture

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High School seniors Jaycob Wahinehookae, Andrew Do and Kenny Le have been named Academic All-Americans by the National Speech and Debate Association.

img.alt: JMS students pose for a picture in their blue choir polos

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Jefferson Middle School’s Concert Choir performed at all five SGUSD elementary schools on March 25, providing students with a preview of the music education opportunities available in middle school.

img.alt: A group of GHS students performing their musical talents

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High’s Pep Band performs for SGUSD staff during a professional development day. San Gabriel Unified’s music programs were awarded the Best Communities for Music Education designation by the National Association of Music Merchants Foundation.

img.alt: Students pose for a picture while making artwork
DMHS students pose with their medal awards

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: All seven of Del Mar High School’s History Day L.A. contestants will advance to the state competition, to be held May 10-12, for their projects on redlining.

img.alt: GHS seniors pose in front of the eagle statue

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High School seniors Carlos Pondevida and Kevin Quach – who both have aspirations to work in the medical field – have been named 2019 National Merit Scholarship finalists.

img.alt: TK student pose while working on an art piece

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: San Gabriel Unified School District’s transitional kindergarten and kindergarten programs jumpstart learning with developmentally appropriate curriculum.

img.alt: Students posing for a picture

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Students spend their lunch relaxing with stress-relief coloring activities in the gym during Gabrielino High School’s third Mental Health Day of the year on Feb. 13.

img.alt: Three Washington students pose for a picture

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Washington Elementary students learn safety tips for arriving and leaving school during the PBIS kickoff event on Feb. 5.

img.alt: Three elementary students pose with their spelling bee rankings

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Fourth-grader Shannon Yan was awarded first place, fifth-grader Miley Trinh was awarded second place and fifth-grader Warren Lukman was awarded third place in the Coolidge Elementary Spelling Bee on Feb. 1.

img.alt: Two JMS students pose with their violins

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Jefferson Middle School orchestra students Sasha Sengelmann and David Wang were selected to the exclusive Southern California School Band and Orchestra Association’s Middle School Orchestra.

img.alt: Wilson student placing a hand print on the wall

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Wilson Elementary students place painted handprints on the playground on Jan. 19 during the school’s first Beautification Day.

img.alt: Three students pose for a picture while they plan the school's garden

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Wilson Elementary students plant succulents in the school’s garden areas during a Beautification Day on Jan. 19.

img.alt: JMS student poses for a picture

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Jefferson Middle School eighth-grader Wang was named to the California Choral Directors Association (CCDA) Junior High/Ninth Grade All-State Honor Choir for the second year in a row. Wang will perform with the choir on March 16 at St. Joseph’s Cathedral in San Jose.

img.alt: JMS choir performing and singing

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Jefferson Middle School music teacher and choir director Rachel Chew conducts students singing “Under Winter Moon” for patients, doctors and staff at City of Hope’s Helford Hospital on Dec. 21.

img.alt: Students playing with drum sticks

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Supported by an award-winning music immersion program, Roosevelt Elementary students improved their performance on California’s English language arts and mathematics standardized tests for the third year in a row.

img.alt: Students coloring intricate mandalas

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High School students, alongside Gabrielino Principal Sharron Heinrich, colored intricate mandalas as soothing music filled the quad during the school’s second Mental Health Awareness Day of the year on Nov. 15. Students engaged in mindfulness activities and learned techniques for anxiety and stress management.

img.alt: Two JMS students pose for a picture

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Jefferson ASB eighth-graders Nathan Kan and Amy Yang prepped Jefferson Middle School’s quad for College Day by setting up maypoles with hoops on top for a football throwing contest; winners received candy to enjoy with their hot dog lunch.

img.alt: Students listening to a lecture about college

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Ashley Tarin talked to Jefferson Middle School students about the benefits of community college, specifically Citrus College, where according to Tarin tuition for California residents is free.

img.alt: A group of students show off their ornaments

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High art teacher Emmett Suess and students show off ornaments they created to adorn California’s Christmas tree in the 2018 National Christmas tree experience on the Ellipse in President’s Park in Washington, D.C.

img.alt: Colorful ornaments pained by GHS students

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Ornaments painted by Gabrielino High art students will represent California in the 2018 National Christmas tree experience on the Ellipse in President’s Park in Washington, D.C.

img.alt: Two governing board student representatives pose for a picture

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High senior Thomas Chung and Del Mar High senior Armando Talamantes will serve as San Gabriel Unified’s 2018-19 Governing Board student representatives.

img.alt: Roosevelt students dress up in Halloween costumes

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Roosevelt Elementary students await the results of the costume contest during the school’s Trunk-or-Treat Halloween celebration on Oct. 20.

img.alt: Two students pose for a picture with their face paintings

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Washington Elementary students show off matching face paintings at the school’s annual Fall Festival on Oct. 20.

img.alt: Students pose for a picture in front of the College bench

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Coolidge Elementary students try out the school’s new friendship bench, which provides students a quiet place to get to know one another and build friendships. The bench was unveiled Oct. 3 as part of the school’s inaugural Friendship Week.

img.alt: GHS ASB students pose for a picture

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High’s Associated Student Body officers pose under a poster promoting social connection during the school’s Mental Health Awareness Day, held Sept. 26.

img.alt: Students are given new school supplies

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Roosevelt Elementary students collect new school supplies donated by Copper Moose Fitness on Aug. 24.

img.alt: Students listening in a classroom

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Wilson Elementary students listen as Principal Ivonne Contreras welcomes them for the 2018-19 year on Aug. 20.

img.alt: FBLA students pose with their awards

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High’s Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA) program advanced six students to the National Leadership Conference in early July.

img.alt: Students working on their assignments in the classroom

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High School’s efforts to promote college readiness and boost student achievement have earned a silver medal ranking on U.S. News and World Report’s 2018 Best High School list.

img.alt: GHS seniors pose for a picture at graduation

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Gabrielino High seniors wait to receive their diplomas during the school’s commencement ceremony on June 6

img.alt: Del Mar senior in graduation attire

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 710px; height: auto
div.p: Del Mar High School students celebrate their successful pursuit of a diploma during the continuation school’s graduation ceremony on June 7.

h1.a: Important Updates to the SGUSD Grab n' Go Meal Distribution

img.alt: Grab n' Go Meal Distribution Schedule

section.p:
Free breakfast and lunch meals for all children
San Gabriel Unified School District will be offering a Grab n’ Go meals to all children ages 18 year and younger within the community. Enrollment status at a school district is NOT required. Children MUST be present to receive meals.

img.alt: School Closures to Remain in Effect for 2019-2020

section.p: Please see letter from Superintendent, Jim Symonds.

img.alt: Distance Learning Begins April 6, 2020

section.p: San Gabriel Unified will shift to a Distance Learning Platform on Monday, April 6, 2020.

img.alt: SGUSD Mental Health and Wellness Resources

section.p: As we all get further away from in-person contact with staff and counselors, please know SGUSD is committed to providing resources and supports to students in need.

section.p:
Free breakfast and lunch meals for all children
San Gabriel Unified School District will be offering a Grab n’ Go meals to all children ages 18 year and younger within the community. Enrollment status at a school district is NOT required. Children MUST be present to receive meals.
